function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Integration of movement data with case-based risk maps for Namibia creates a dynamic framework for understanding connectivity between malaria risk areas.","Impact":"Without proper integration, the movement data may not accurately reflect the spread of malaria, leading to ineffective or misdirected control measures.","Mitigation":"Ensure the accuracy and reliability of movement data through thorough validation and verification processes.","Technologies":"Geographic information systems, data validation algorithms, and mobile phone tracking technologies.","People":"Malaria program planners, public health officials, and researchers.","Owner":"Malaria elimination program coordinators and data analysts."},{"Description":"Achieving malaria elimination in Namibia by 2020 requires a clearly defined strategy to deploy resources effectively.","Impact":"Without a clear strategy, resources may be deployed inefficiently, leading to suboptimal impact on malaria transmission.","Mitigation":"Develop a detailed and evidence-based strategy that prioritizes high-risk areas and populations, and monitors the effectiveness of resource deployment.","Technologies":"Surveillance systems, geographic information systems, and data analysis tools.","People":"Malaria program planners, public health officials, and policymakers.","Owner":"Malaria elimination program coordinators and public health agencies."},{"Description":"Targeting aggressive attack measures to source communities and implementing sustainable measures in sink regions is essential for reducing malaria transmission in Namibia.","Impact":"Failure to target source and sink regions effectively may result in continued transmission and spread of malaria, undermining elimination efforts.","Mitigation":"Implement aggressive case management, vector control, and surveillance in source regions, and sustainable measures to reduce receptivity in sink regions. Monitor and adjust interventions based on ongoing data analysis.","Technologies":"Geographic information systems, mobile phone CDRs, and surveillance systems.","People":"Malaria program planners, public health officials, and community leaders.","Owner":"Malaria elimination program coordinators and community health organizations."}]}
